poem:
"From Marble to Flesh"

In the quiet hum of Rome's winter,
A scribe rested, defaced; ink felled
In one unforgiving moment.
Stories unyielding, left to brood
In the silent halls of thought.
Yet, even as limbs betrayed,
A phoenix rose from ashes grey:
The Buddha of Suburbia reborn,
In the heart's haven where tales reside,
Proving words, once freed, need no stride.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "‘Although I’m tetraplegic, I’ve started to feel normal’: Hanif Kureishi on staging The Buddha of Suburbia It’s been an unfathomably difficult 18 months for Hanif Kureishi. In 2022, the esteemed British writer went to Rome with his wife for Christmas, where he fainted and fell. When he woke up in a pool of blood he had lost the use of his hands, arms and legs. For more than a year, he was confined to hospital". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
